column4: DES-40 CBC(EXPORT, insecure)40 bits strength of cipher suites were designed to operate at reduced key lengths in order to comply with US regulations about the export of cryptographic software containing certain strong encryption algorithms (see Export of cryptography from the United States). These weak suites are forbidden in TLS 1.1 and later.
column6: RC4-128(insecure)The RC4 attacks weaken or break RC4 used in SSL/TLS. Use of RC4 is prohibited by RFC 7465.
column7: RC4-40(EXPORT, insecure)The RC4 attacks weaken or break RC4 used in SSL/TLS.
